info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE AND CENTRAL UNION COUNTIES IN CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 617 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Marysville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Delaware, Marysville, Richwood, Ashley, Radnor, Milford Center, Ostrander, Magnetic Springs, Delaware State Park, Stratford, Bellepoint, Broadway, Warrensburg, Pharisburg, Watkins, Pottersburg, Leonardsburg, State Route 229 at US Route 23, Kilbourne and New Dover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
